description:
托福口语的200个基本词非常重要，本文总结了基本动词词汇部分（100个）。其中，对部分动词增加了些例句，大家通过这些例句可以体会到这些词虽简单但词义深广，剩下的动词，同学们可以自己尝试着造句以加深对这部分单词的理解与运用。

第一部分 基本动词词汇

Basic Verbs, Prepositions, Articles, Pronouns, etc.

1. come (verb.)

Come here!
到这里来！
He will never come to much (= will never be successful).
他将来绝不会很有作为。
How did you come to be so foolish?
你为什么如此愚蠢？
On what page does it come?
它在哪一页？

2. get (verb.)

We can get 15 channels on TV.
我们可以收看到15个频道的电视节目。
Do you get me?
你明白我的意思吗？
Ah! I’ve got you there!
啊！这下我可难到你啦。

3. give (verb.)

He gave me his cold.
他把感冒传给我。
Sorry to have given you trouble.
对不起，打扰了。
Ladies and gentlemen, I give you our speaker for tonight.
女士们，先生们，让我向诸位介绍今晚的演讲者。

4. go (verb.)

Go get a doctor. 去叫医生来！
How goes it with you? 你近来情况如何？
There are six minutes to go. 还有六分钟。

5. keep (verb.)

Does your watch keep good time?
你的表走得准吗？
Sorry to have kept you waiting.
对不起，让你久等了。
Does your school keep all day?
你们学校全天上课吗？

6. let (verb.)

Let us pray.
让我们祈祷吧。
The pair of rubber shoes let (in) water.
这双胶鞋漏水。
The flat lets for 1500 yuan a month.
这套公寓每月租金1500元。

7. make (verb.)

Make yourself comfortable.
请随意。
What time do you make it? (What do you make the time?)
你看现在几点了？
He made to go.
他要走了。

8. put (verb.)

I put a question to him.
我向他提出一个问题。
What a way you have of putting things!
瞧你这人怎么那样说话！
I put her at about 35.
我估计她大概35岁。

9. seem (verb.)

Be what you seem (to be).
要表里如一。
It seems as if it is going to rain.
看来快下雨了。
I can’t seem to solve it right now.
看来我无法立刻解决它。

10. take (verb.)

Be careful not to take cold.
小心不要着凉。
Do you take me for a fool?
你以为我是傻瓜吗？
Don’t take it so seriously.
不要把这事看得太严重。

11. be (verb.)

Can such things be?
可能有这样的事吗？
He is come.
他已经来了。

12. do (verb.)

Will you do me a favour?
帮我个忙好吗？
They do you very well at that hotel.
那家旅馆服务很周到。
What"s doing over there?
那边在干什么？

13. have (verb.)

May I have one?
可以给我一个吗？
Let"s have a talk.
咱们谈一谈。
You have me, haven"t you?
你明白我的意思了，对不对？

14. say (verb.)

We mean what we say.
我们说的话是算数的。
What do these figures say?
这些数字说明什么？
You may well say so.
你完全可以这么说。

15. see (verb.)

Watch and see how others do it.
好好看着人家是怎么做的。
See you.
再见！
Wait and see.
等着瞧吧。

16. send (verb.)

God send it may not be so!
但愿不是这样！
Send for the doctor, please.
请叫医生来。
Please send the letter on to Tom.
请将此信交给汤姆。

title: 新托福流利口语200个基本词（一）——动词部分

description:
25、 fill a prescription 按处方抓药

Would you please fill this prescription for me?

26、 fill in for 代替； 同义：fill one’s place(position、 shoes). take the place of. take over Say,

Dave, can you fill in for me tonight at the restaurant? I’d like to go out of town.

27、food for thought 令人思考的东西；同义：thought-provoking

There is a lot food for thought in what he had to say.

28、for nothing 免费

To pay to see that movie would be foolish、 when you can see it on TV for nothing.

29、from top to bottom 从上到下

A: Maybe you lost your walletin this room.

B: I’ve searched it from top to bottom..

30、 get of on the wrong foot 开始事情就做错了

I got off on the wrong foot、 and I don’t have any idea which way to turn now.

31、get a lot out of something 从……学到很多

The training program was difficult, but she got a lot out of it.

32、 get at 想说

Do you understand what I’m getting at?

33、 get away with 对…..摆脱惩罚

A: Did you know that Bob is leaving for home tonight? He isn’t planning to take his final exams.

B: He can’t get away with that

34、get going 赶紧行动； 同义：get moving

A: It looks like we won’t have enough time to do all we wanted to.

B: Who says we won’t? let’s get going. 

35、 get on one’s nerve 招惹某人神经了

A: Why did you come to the meeting late? I left a message with your roommate about the time change.

B: She has a very short memory and it really gets on my nerve sometimes.

36、 get started on 开始做

We should get started on the project.

37、 get time off from work 从工作中抽时间

Oh、 so she was able to get time off from the work.

38、give credibility to 相信

A: did you hear about Jim?

B: I wouldn’t give that rumor any credibility.

39、go easy on 温和对待

Well, since it’s your first and only ticket, the judge will probably go easy on you.

40、go in one ear and out the other 一耳朵进、一耳朵出

Well, you know Mike, everything’s in one ear and out the other.

41、go jogging 去跑步

Are you ready to go jogging?

42、go to one’s head 某人自负

A: Have you noticed how John’s changed since he became student government president?

B: I think the whole thing has gone to his head, and he used to be so sociable and open.

43、got the time 几点了

A: Got the time?

B: It’s a little after ten.

44、 graduation announcements 毕业典礼请柬

Have you ordered your graduation announcements? 

45、graon about 抱怨

How come Michael’s always groaning about something?

46、guest lecturer 客座教授

The only person who understood the guest lecturerwas the professor.

47、hand-me-down 送的东西

A: What a gorgeousjacket. It must have cost a fortune.

B: Not at all. It’s a hand-me-down.

48、hand down 易如反掌

Lee won the chess match hands down.

49、have a way with 擅长

Bonnie really has a way with words.

title: 高分没商量：100个雅思听力高频词汇（2）

description:
1、 be head and shoulders above 好许多

In calculus, Joe is head and shoulders above his classmates.

2、be in the dark 蒙在鼓里

A: Do you have any idea what his notice is about?

B: I’m as in the dark as you are.

3、be stuck 卡住了

I can’t get this window open. It’s stuck.

29、 bite off more than one can chew. 贪多嚼不烂

A: I hear you’re taking an advanced physics course this semester.

B: I think I’ve bitten off more than I can chew.

4、 break new ground 有了新的突破

His architecturaldesign broke new ground in the field. 

5、benefit concert 慈善音乐会

We need to let everyone know about the benefit concert、 but we don’t have

much money for advertising.

6、 busy signal 占线考试大论坛

I’ve been calling David for the past half hour, but I keep getting a busysignal.

7、between you and me 你我之间、保密

8、call for

A、打电话找

Tom just called for you.

B、预报

The forecast calls for heavy rain again tonight. Aren’t you glad we’ll be getting away from this for a week?

C、问

It’s probably in the new part of town. We’ll have to call for directions.

9、 call it a day 就此结束

A: I’m really glad our club decides to raise money for the children’s hospital, and most of the people we’ve phoned seemed happy to contribute.

B: Yeah、 I agree. Now we’ve gone through all the numbers on our list now, so I guess we can call it a day.

10、cash the check 兑现支票

Have your sister cashed her paycheck?

11、clear off 收拾、整理

It’s about time we clear off the desk.

12、come down (雨、雪)下起来

The heavy rain is coming down, now.

13、 come in first in the race 比赛第一名

Not only did Jill come in first in the race but she also had her best running time of the season.

14、come what may 不管怎样

We’ll pick you up tomorrow at eight, come what may. 

15、cost somebody an arm and a leg

A: Did you see the diamondring Bill gave to Linda?

B: I sure did. It must have cost him an arm and a leg.

16、 cut it out 闭嘴

I told you to cut it out.

17、be cut out for 生来时做……的

Dr. Hamilton doesn’t feel Larry is cut out for the medical profession.

18、department chair 系主任

I didn’t write that memoto the department chair.

19、dirt cheap 非常便宜

A: You’ve already furnished your apartment?

B: I’ve found some used furniture that was dirt cheap.

20、 do with 用…..凑合. do without 没有……也行

You can do with your girlfriend.

You can do without your girlfriend

21、 dog tired 特别累、同义：run down. worn out. out of steam

I’m dog tired these days. I’m working on seven articles.

22、 down jacket 羽绒服

23、drive somebody up the wall 让某人发疯；同义：drive somebody out of one’s mind

The sound of all that raffic is driving me out of my mind.

24、 fall back on 依赖

A: Were you able to understand that French novel without any help from theteacher?

B: I did pretty well、 but I had to fall back on my dictionary occasionally.

title: 高分没商量：100个雅思听力高频词汇（1）

description:
考研之初，大部分人都是两眼一抹黑，到最后功课复习得怎么样不说，因为某些信息掌握不足而功败垂成，今天小研就以过来人的身份说说考研要注意收集的信息。各招生单位在考研专业科目的命题、阅卷以及最终的录取上有很大的自主权，因此考研信息因报考单位不同而不同，需要研苞有针对性地寻找。从确定报考单位、明晰复习范围到搜寻录取信息，信息工作可以说是贯穿考研全过程，万不可掉以轻心，以下四大信息复习之前必须掌握。

一、招生专业目录

近几年高校改革力度加大，专业调整频繁，因此专业名称也经常会有变化，很多考生会发现早就瞅准的专业突然因为改革的原因而“蒸发”，遇到此类情况同学们可以看看意向中的专业是否被合并或更名，一般不会直接取消。招生专业目录一般在每年七八月份公布，考生应及时查看报考单位的招生目录，最终确定自己的报考方向。

二、公共课考试内容与题型

这里的公共课指全国统考的科目，包括政治、英语和数学。这些科目的考试知识点和考试要求在每年六七月份出版的各科考试大纲上有详细规定。一些变动较大的科目，必须以新大纲为准进行复习。就政治和英语这两门比较重要的公共课来说，英语其实考查重点变动不大，大家只要认准历年真题来复习就没问题，相对来说政治可能各种新增考点和考查重点变动会多一些，但也脱不开主体的内容，对于一些新增的考点，等考试大纲出来以后，再查缺补漏一下即可。

三、专业课考试内容与题型

公共课还好，就算是考纲不出来，根据历年的考纲和真题也还是可以顺利复习的，但专业课却基本上没有什么书面的复习纲要可以提供给大家，这就需要自己去搜集。专业课涉及的往往不止一门课程，教科书也有多本，复习量极大，这方面信息的搜集可以采取如下几种方法：一是查看历年真题，来分析一下哪些是高频考点；二是可以询问师哥师姐，跟他们借一下做过的笔记和划过重点的教科书。其实就算现在明令禁止专业课划定考试范围和教科书，也总是有一些经典的教科书可供参考的。

四、录取调剂信息

16考研的同学们也许会想现在关注录取调剂信息是不是太早了，其实不然，现在就说说关注的好处：①可以获得相关专业的学长信息，找学长是考研路上必备选项，可以从学长那里获取导师信息、获取考研资料，甚至给你考研辅导。②收集调剂信息，可以为考研之后成绩不理想的同学提供出路。

考研信息并不都是公开摆在台面上等你收集的。有些信息例如国家考研政策、招生单位的特殊规定、专业目录、各单位招生简章等，大家都可以轻易收集。有些不对外公开的信息就需要多留意一下了，这些也往往是对于考研来说很重要的部分，所以即使考研复习再忙碌，该掌握的信息也一定要掌握，双管齐下，才能成为最后的胜者。
